pr_title: [Streaming] Increasing configuration of various streaming exchanges, small improvements

timeline.message: Increasing configurability of various streaming exchanges, small improvements

timeline.author: badgerwithagun
badgerwithagun

replies.bodyText: @badgerwithagun I use these urls directly in my own code and would like to expose them.
replies.author: earce

timeline.author: badgerwithagun

replies.bodyText: same reason, I use these functions directly and would like a handle on them and receive updates for them if the underlying code changes.
replies.author: earce

timeline.bodyText: You've added these constructor overloads but no code that uses them. Are you planning to call them on construction in the StreamingExchange implementations in some follow-up PR?
timeline.author: badgerwithagun

replies.bodyText: I don't have immediate plans for them, I think being restricted to use the defaults is not ideal and I use these outside of this codebase (I think it makes sense to have them in place)
replies.author: earce

replies.bodyText: I'd be intrigued to hear how and why you are using the underlying streaming services directly (rather than just exposing nice entry points in the StreamingExchanges, but fair enough for now.
replies.author: badgerwithagun

replies.bodyText: @badgerwithagun in short I want raw json payloads, I'm not interested in the unified objects Xchange uses so I have found a few ways of accomplishing this and using the mature parts of Xchange's code.
replies.author: earce

timeline.message: adding optimization for coinbase currency pair code
